member.name: T:System.Runtime.Analyzers.OverrideMethodsOnComparableTypesAnalyzer
member.summary: CA1036: A public or protected type implements the System.IComparable interface and does not override Object.Equals or does not overload the language-specific operator for equality, inequality, less than, or greater than. The rule does not report a violation if the type inherits only an implementation of the interface.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Analyzers.DefineAccessorsForAttributeArgumentsAnalyzer
member.summary:
CA1019: Define accessors for attribute arguments
Cause: In its constructor, an attribute defines arguments that do not have corresponding properties.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Consider changing the ComVisible attribute on {0} to false, and opting in at the type level..

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.CA1017_NoAttribute
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Because {0} exposes externally visible types, mark it with ComVisible(false) at the assembly level and then mark all types within the assembly that should be exposed to COM clients with ComVisible(true)..

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.MarkAllAssembliesWithComVisible
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Mark all assemblies with ComVisible.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.MarkAllAssembliesWithComVisibleDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible attribute indicates whether COM clients can use the library. Good design dictates that developers explicitly indicate COM visibility. The default value for this attribute is 'true'. However, the best design is to mark the assembly ComVisible false, and then mark types, interfaces, and individual members as ComVisible true, as appropriate..

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.MarkAssembliesWithCLSCompliantAttribute
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Mark assemblies with CLSCompliantAttribute.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.MarkAssembliesWithCLSCompliantDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Assemblies should explicitly state their CLS compliance using the CLSCompliant attribute. An assembly without this attribute is not CLS-compliant. Assemblies, modules, and types can be CLS-compliant even if some parts of the assembly, module, or type are not CLS-compliant. The following rules apply: 1) If the element is marked CLSCompliant, any noncompliant members must have the CLSCompliant attribute present with its argument set to false. 2) A comparable CLS-compliant alternative member must be supplied f [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.MarkAttributesWithAttributeUsage
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Specify AttributeUsage attribute on '{0}' attribute class..

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.OverloadOperatorEqualsOnIComparableInterface
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Overload operator Equals and comparison operators when implementing System.IComparable.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.OverloadOperatorEqualsOnIComparableInterfaceDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Types that implement IComparable should redefine Equals and comparison operators to keep the meanings of less than, greater than, and equals consistent throughout the type..

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.OverloadOperatorEqualsOnOverridingValueTypeEquals
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Overload operator equals on overriding ValueType.Equals.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.OverloadOperatorEqualsOnOverridingValueTypeEquals1
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Overload operator equals on overriding ValueType.Equals.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.OverloadOperatorEqualsOnOverridingValueTypeEqualsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Value types that redefine System.ValueType.Equals should redefine the equality operator as well to ensure that these members return the same results. This helps ensure that types that rely on Equals (such as ArrayList and Hashtable) behave in a manner that is expected and consistent with the equality operator..

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.TypeOwnsDisposableFieldButIsNotDisposable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Type '{0}' owns disposable fields but is not disposable.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Analyzers.SystemRuntimeAnalyzersResources.TypesThatOwnDisposableFieldsShouldBeDisposable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Types that own disposable fields should be disposable.

member.summary: CA2231: Overload operator equals on overriding ValueType.Equals

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Analyzers.OverloadOperatorEqualsOnOverridingValueTypeEqualsAnalyzer
member.summary: CA2231: Complain if the type implements Equals without overloading the equality operator.
